description: ERECTION OF A PROPOSED SINGLE STOREY OUTBUILDING IN THE REAR GARDEN FOR USE ANCILLARY TO THE ENJOYMENT OF THE DWELLINGHOUSE.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - No Use of Flat Roof  - Access to the flat roof of the development hereby permitted shall be for maintenance or emergency purposes only, and the flat roof shall not be used as a roof garden, terrace, patio or similar amenity area.

Condition : 5 - The development hereby permitted shall not be rented, sold independently or occupied at any time other than for purposes ancillary to the main residential use of the dwelling known as 37 St James' Road Mitcham CR4 2DE.

Condition : 6 - Removal of PD (walls and fences) - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no fencing or walls, which would sub-divide the site and separate the outbuilding hereby approved from the residential curtilage of the main dwelling, shall be constructed without planning permission first obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant -Approved Schemes
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the National Planning Policy Framework, London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to the delivery of sustainable development, by:
1. Providing a formal pre-application advice service, details to be found on Planning pre-application advice service on LBM's website
2. Providing written policies and guidance, which is available to view on LBM's website.
3. Where appropriate, negotiating amendments to secure a positive decision.
4. Determining applications in a timely manner including providing a fast track service, details to be found on Get a quicker planning decision on LBM's website.

In this instance:
i) The application was acceptable as submitted, and approved with an agreed determination date.

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE
Building Regulations 
Please note that this is a planning permission only and you may also require approval under the Building Regulations. If you are in any doubt about this you can get further information via https://www.merton.gov.uk/planning-and-buildings/building-control  or by emailing building.control@merton.gov.uk.
